p: As shown in Table 3, twelve components were identified in this oil, which represented about 96% of the total chromatographical material. The studied essential oil was dominated by the presence of phenylpropanoids constituting 76.9% of the total oil composition. Monoterpene hydrocarbons comprised 10.9% while sesquiterpenoids constituted only 8.2% of which 4.5% were hydrocarbons and 3.7% were oxygenated ones. The major constituent of fruit essential oil was characterized as myristicin (76.1%).
